means: （时间或空间）延长，伸长( lengthen的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He lengthened his stride to keep up with her.
The silence lengthened as Thorne unnecessarily shuffled some papers.
sentence.Network_cn: 索恩整理着一些本无须整理的文件，沉默还在延续。

sentence.Network_en: The runway had to be lengthened.

PerfectNetExp.abs: effects of axial stress on healing of lengthened callus ., 轴向应力在延长段骨痂生长愈合中的作用.
(3) While in La-Nina years, the main period of low-frequency oscillation has the lengthened tendency.（3）La-Nina事件有使低频振荡周期延长的趋势。

entry.def: When something lengthens or when you lengthen it, it increases in length.

example.tran: 残阳下的影子越拉越长。

example.ex: She began to walk faster, but he lengthened his stride to keep up with her...
example.tran: 她开始加快步子，但他加大了步幅跟着她。

entry.tran: （使）（时间）延长；（使…）持续更长时间
entry.def: When something lengthens or when you lengthen it, it lasts for a longer time than it did previously.

example.ex: Vacations have lengthened and the work week has shortened...
example.tran: 假期延长，工作周就缩短了。

example.ex: The council does not support lengthening the school day to fit in other activities.
example.tran: 委员会不支持通过延长在校时间来插入其他活动。

means.word_mean: 1. drawn out or made longer spatially;

sentences.sentence: "the extended airport runways can accommodate larger planes"
"a prolonged black line across the page"
